Package com.cyberfront.crdt.operation

Class Operation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyberfront.crdt.operation.Operation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Operation>
    public final class Operation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Operation>
    The Operation class is intended to be a base / abstract class for the set of operations which would normally be expected to be performed on a persistence store. The derived operations are CREATE, READ, UPDATE and DELETE (CRUD). These CRUD operations each hold JsonDiff operations which are used in aggregate to rebuild a JSON object. These operations each have a timestamp which is used to order operations. In the event two operations have the same timestamp, an operation Id is used to break the tie. In a distributed setup, it is theoretically possible for two operations generated at different nodes to have both same time stamp and the same ID number, which will lead to ambiguity if the should both appear in the same CRDT. As a final tie breaker, the hash value of the two operations will be used.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Operation.OperationType
      The Enum OperationType lists the types of operations which comprise the types of operations which can be performed on JSON objects

      • Operation

        public Operation​(Operation.OperationType type,
                 java.lang.Long timestamp)
        This constructor initializes elements of this abstract class instance given an operation and a timestamp associated with executing the operation.
        Parameters:
        type - Specification of the operation type, but generally limited to CREATE, READ and DELETE
        timestamp - The effective timestamp associated with the execution of this operation

      • Operation

        public Operation​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode op,
                 java.lang.Long timestamp)
        This instantiates a new UpdateOperation given an operation in a JsonNode and a timestamp. The operation is not validated as conforming to RFC 6902
        Parameters:
        op - The operation, consisting of a JsonNode conforming to RFC 6902.
        timestamp - The effective time stamp of the operation

      • Operation

        public Operation​(Operation src)
        This is essentially a copy constructor for duplicating some source AbstractOperation
        Parameters:
        src - The source operation to copy

      • Operation

        public Operation​(java.util.UUID id,
                 Operation.OperationType type,
                 com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode op,
                 java.lang.Long timestamp)
        Fully specified operation constructor which directs the values of all elements in the class instance
        Parameters:
        id - The unique identifier for operations
        type - Enumeration describing the type of operation this instance is to perform
        timestamp - Timestamp of the operation
        op - Operation details associated with the object; should be instantiated only for UPDATE operations

      • getOp

        public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode getOp()
        Retrieve the JSON update operation. If the operation type isn't UPDATE, this will be null; otherwise it will be a JsonNode which conforms to RFC 6902.
        Returns:
        The JSON Patch, compliant with RFC 6902, for this operation if it's an UPDATE operation type, or null otherwise.

        public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode processOperation​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode document)
                                                         throws com.github.fge.jsonpatch.JsonPatchException,
                                                                java.io.IOException
        Process the operation on the document presented and return the resulting document to the calling routine
        Parameters:
        document - The document to which the operation will be applied
        Returns:
        The JSON document which results from applying the operation to the given document
        Throws:
        com.github.fge.jsonpatch.JsonPatchException - results when the operation cannot be applied to the provided document
        java.io.IOException - results when the something other than an operation is encoded in one of the derived class instances
